intro: Veratrum maximowiczii var. angustipetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petalled white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Russian Far East and northeastern China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stem that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and have a waxy surface, while its roots contain toxic alkaloids. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
